title: SB 1.19.24 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 27-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Jena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Galadhara Shiva Sadi Gauravaka
Devrinda Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama
Rama Hare Hare Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet

first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.

are bhagavatam is a very very vast literature but everything is explained
in the bhagavatam in answer to these two questions are
by Pariksit from Sukhadeva Goswami. The conclusion arrived at thereof is that devotional service
of the Lord Shri Krishna as it is confirmed by the Lord himself in the last phases of
the Bhagavad Gita is the last word in relation to everyone's permanent duty in life. Situationally
according to our present condition or situation we may have some temporary duties like a student
has got a duty to study as long as the student. A householder has a duty towards maintenance
of his family members but that is also limited to the period of the life of the householder.
When he is a householder if the question is asked what is everyone's permanent duty
in life that is answered in the Bhagavatam. The permanent duty of everyone is to render
service to Krishna.
Maharaj Pariksit was already aware of this fact because he is a devotee and what does
a devotee do? He simply engages in Krishna's service to please Krishna. So Maharaj Pariksit
was aware as a devotee but he wanted the great sages assembled there to unanimously give
their verdict on his conviction.
So that he might be able to go on with his confirmed duty without controversy. See Pariksit
is taking a very humble position. He is respecting the great sages who are assembled there as
superiors even though he himself is a pure devotee and is well aware that his only business
is spiritual activity.
That he knew. But taking humble position he wanted to get it confirmed from authority.
Now Pariksit has especially mentioned the word Shuddha are perfectly correct.
